body.p: The IFRIC observed that, in developing IFRS 1 First‑time Adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards, the International Accounting Standards Board discussed whether IFRS 1 should exempt first‑time adopters of IFRSs from the effects of restatement in their first IFRS financial statements. Paragraph BC67 of IFRS 1 states:

lq.p: Some argued that the cost of restating financial statements for the effects of hyperinflation in periods before the date of transition to IFRSs would exceed the benefits, particularly if the currency is no longer hyperinflationary. However, the Board concluded that such restatement should be required, because hyperinflation can make unadjusted financial statements meaningless or misleading.
